trans-unit.source: If delete is non-nil, the function deletes the text between start and end after copying it, like delete-and-extract-region.
trans-unit.target: If delete is non- nil , the function deletes the text between start and end after copying it, like delete-and-extract-region .

trans-unit.source: If <var>depth</var> is nonzero, treat the starting position as being <var>depth</var> parentheses deep. The scanner moves forward or backward through the buffer until the depth changes to zero <var>count</var> times. Hence, a positive value for <var>depth</var> has the effect of moving out <var>depth</var> levels of parenthesis from the starting position, while a negative <var>depth</var> has the effect of moving deeper by <var>-depth</var> levels of parenthesis.
trans-unit.target: If <var>depth</var> is nonzero, treat the starting position as being <var>depth</var> parentheses deep. The scanner moves forward or backward through the buffer until the depth changes to zero <var>count</var> times. Hence, a positive value for <var>depth</var> has the effect of moving out <var>depth</var> levels of parenthesis from the starting position, while a negative <var>depth</var> has the effect of moving deeper by <var>-depth</var> levels of parenthesis.

trans-unit.source: If device-name is a non-empty string identifying a network interface name (see network-interface-list), only handle packets received on that interface. If device-name is nil (the default), handle packets received on any interface.
trans-unit.target: If device-name is a non-empty string identifying a network interface name (see network-interface-list ), only handle packets received on that interface. If device-name is nil (the default), handle packets received on any interface.

trans-unit.source: If dir-flag is non-nil, make-temp-file creates an empty directory instead of an empty file. It returns the file name, not the directory name, of that directory. See Directory Names.
trans-unit.target: If dir-flag is non- nil , make-temp-file creates an empty directory instead of an empty file. It returns the file name, not the directory name, of that directory. See Directory Names.

trans-unit.source: If display-flag is non-nil, as it always is in interactive calls, that means to display the new buffer by calling pop-to-buffer. If norecord is non-nil, that means not to put the new buffer to the front of the buffer list.
trans-unit.target: If display-flag is non- nil , as it always is in interactive calls, that means to display the new buffer by calling pop-to-buffer . If norecord is non- nil , that means not to put the new buffer to the front of the buffer list.

trans-unit.target: If display is non- nil , then call-process redisplays the buffer as output is inserted. (However, if the coding system chosen for decoding output is undecided , meaning deduce the encoding from the actual data, then redisplay sometimes cannot continue once non-

trans-unit.source: If divisor is specified, this uses the kind of division operation that corresponds to mod, rounding downward.
trans-unit.target: If divisor is specified, this uses the kind of division operation that corresponds to mod , rounding downward.

trans-unit.source: If divisor is zero, mod signals an arith-error error if both arguments are integers, and returns a NaN otherwise.
trans-unit.target: If divisor is zero, mod signals an arith-error error if both arguments are integers, and returns a NaN otherwise.

trans-unit.source: If do-all is non-nil, or if the user option apropos-do-all is non-nil, then apropos also shows key bindings for the functions that are found; it also shows all interned symbols, not just meaningful ones (and it lists them in the return value as well).
trans-unit.target: If do-all is non- nil , or if the user option apropos-do-all is non- nil , then apropos also shows key bindings for the functions that are found; it also shows all interned symbols, not just meaningful ones (and it lists them in the return value as well).

trans-unit.source: If doc is non-nil, it becomes the function documentation of name. Otherwise, any documentation provided by definition is used.
trans-unit.target: If doc is non- nil , it becomes the function documentation of name . Otherwise, any documentation provided by definition is used.

trans-unit.source: If dontroute-flag is non-nil, the process can only send to hosts on the same network as the local host.
trans-unit.target: If dontroute-flag is non- nil , the process can only send to hosts on the same network as the local host.

trans-unit.source: If ellipsis is non-nil, it should be a string which will replace the end of string (including any padding) if it extends beyond width, unless the display width of string is equal to or less than the display width of ellipsis. If ellipsis is non-nil and not a string, it stands for the value of the variable truncate-string-ellipsis.
trans-unit.target: If ellipsis is non- nil , it should be a string which will replace the end of string (including any padding) if it extends beyond width , unless the display width of string is equal to or less than the display width of ellipsis . If ellipsis is non- nil and not a string, it stands for the value of the variable truncate-string-ellipsis .

trans-unit.source: If <var>environment</var> is provided, it specifies an alist of macro definitions that shadow the currently defined macros. Byte compilation uses this feature.
trans-unit.target: If <var>environment</var> is provided, it specifies an alist of macro definitions that shadow the currently defined macros. Byte compilation uses this feature.

trans-unit.source: If eop is non-nil, that means do only left-justification if current-justification specifies full justification. This is used for the last line of a paragraph; even if the paragraph as a whole is fully justified, the last line should not be.
trans-unit.target: If eop is non- nil , that means do only left-justification if current-justification specifies full justification. This is used for the last line of a paragraph; even if the paragraph as a whole is fully justified, the last line should not be.

trans-unit.source: If <var>event</var> is a click or button-down event, this returns the location of the event. If <var>event</var> is a drag event, this returns the drag’s starting position.
trans-unit.target: If <var>event</var> is a click or button-down event, this returns the location of the event. If <var>event</var> is a drag event, this returns the drag’s starting position.

trans-unit.source: If <var>event</var> is a drag event, this returns the position where the user released the mouse button. If <var>event</var> is a click or button-down event, the value is actually the starting position, which is the only position such events have.
trans-unit.target: If <var>event</var> is a drag event, this returns the position where the user released the mouse button. If <var>event</var> is a click or button-down event, the value is actually the starting position, which is the only position such events have.

trans-unit.source: If <var>exit-data</var> is a string, its contents are stuffed into the terminal input buffer so that the shell (or whatever program next reads input) can read them.
trans-unit.target: If <var>exit-data</var> is a string, its contents are stuffed into the terminal input buffer so that the shell (or whatever program next reads input) can read them.

trans-unit.source: If exit-data is an integer, that is used as the exit status of the Emacs process. (This is useful primarily in batch operation; see Batch Mode.)
trans-unit.target: If exit-data is an integer, that is used as the exit status of the Emacs process. (This is useful primarily in batch operation; see Batch Mode.)

trans-unit.source: If <var>exit-data</var> is neither an integer nor a string, or is omitted, that means to use the (system-specific) exit status which indicates successful program termination.
trans-unit.target: If <var>exit-data</var> is neither an integer nor a string, or is omitted, that means to use the (system-specific) exit status which indicates successful program termination.

trans-unit.source: If <var>face</var> already has a default face spec, this macro does nothing.
trans-unit.target: If <var>face</var> already has a default face spec, this macro does nothing.

trans-unit.source: If <var>family</var> is specified but not available, Emacs will try the other families given in <var>alternate-families</var>, one by one, until it finds a family that does exist.
trans-unit.target: If <var>family</var> is specified but not available, Emacs will try the other families given in <var>alternate-families</var> , one by one, until it finds a family that does exist.

trans-unit.source: If <var>field</var> is negative, sorting is by the -<var>field</var>th field from the end of the line. This command is useful for sorting tables.
trans-unit.target: If <var>field</var> is negative, sorting is by the - <var>field</var> th field from the end of the line. This command is useful for sorting tables.

trans-unit.source: If file-handler is non-nil, then look for a file name handler for the current buffer’s default-directory, and invoke that file name handler to make the process. If there is no such handler, proceed as if file-handler were nil.
trans-unit.target: If file-handler is non- nil , then look for a file name handler for the current buffer’s default-directory , and invoke that file name handler to make the process. If there is no such handler, proceed as if file-handler were nil .

trans-unit.source: If <var>file</var> is a directory, changes for all files in that directory will be notified. This does not work recursively.
trans-unit.target: If <var>file</var> is a directory, changes for all files in that directory will be notified. This does not work recursively.

trans-unit.source: If filename does not contain either a directory name, or the suffix .el or .elc, this function insists on adding one of these suffixes, and it will not load from a file whose name is just filename with no added suffix. (The variable load-suffixes specifies the exact required suffixes.)
trans-unit.target: If filename does not contain either a directory name, or the suffix .el or .elc , this function insists on adding one of these suffixes, and it will not load from a file whose name is just filename with no added suffix. (The variable load-suffixes specifies the exact required suffixes.)

trans-unit.source: If filename has additional names aside from filename, it continues to have those names. In fact, adding the name newname with add-name-to-file and then deleting filename has the same effect as renaming, aside from momentary intermediate states and treatment of errors, directories and symbolic links.
trans-unit.target: If filename has additional names aside from filename , it continues to have those names. In fact, adding the name newname with add-name-to-file and then deleting filename has the same effect as renaming, aside from momentary intermediate states and treatment of errors, directories and symbolic links.

trans-unit.source: If filename is nil or the empty string, that stands for “no visited file”. In this case, set-visited-file-name marks the buffer as having no visited file, without changing the buffer’s modified flag.
trans-unit.target: If filename is nil or the empty string, that stands for “no visited file”. In this case, set-visited-file-name marks the buffer as having no visited file, without changing the buffer’s modified flag.

trans-unit.source: If filename is a directory name (see Directory Names), write-file uses the name of the visited file, in directory filename. If the buffer is not visiting a file, it uses the buffer name instead.
trans-unit.target: If filename is a directory name (see Directory Names), write-file uses the name of the visited file, in directory filename . If the buffer is not visiting a file, it uses the buffer name instead.

trans-unit.source: If filename is a non-empty string, this function changes the name of the file visited in the current buffer to filename. (If the buffer had no visited file, this gives it one.) The next time the buffer is saved it will go in the newly-specified file.
trans-unit.target: If filename is a non-empty string, this function changes the name of the file visited in the current buffer to filename . (If the buffer had no visited file, this gives it one.) The next time the buffer is saved it will go in the newly-specified file.

trans-unit.target: If <var>filename</var> is a relative file name, such as

trans-unit.source: If filename is local, whether magic or not, this function does nothing and returns nil. Otherwise it returns the file name of the local copy file.
trans-unit.target: If filename is local, whether magic or not, this function does nothing and returns nil . Otherwise it returns the file name of the local copy file.

trans-unit.source: If fin is not a NULL pointer, it will be called with the ptr as the argument when the user-ptr object is garbage-collected. Don’t run any expensive code in a finalizer, because GC must finish quickly to keep Emacs responsive.
trans-unit.target: If fin is not a NULL pointer, it will be called with the ptr as the argument when the user-ptr object is garbage-collected. Don’t run any expensive code in a finalizer, because GC must finish quickly to keep Emacs responsive.

trans-unit.source: If firstonly is non-ascii, then the value is a single vector representing the first key sequence found, rather than a list of all possible key sequences. If firstonly is t, then the value is the first key sequence, except that key sequences consisting entirely of
trans-unit.target: If firstonly is non-ascii , then the value is a single vector representing the first key sequence found, rather than a list of all possible key sequences. If firstonly is t , then the value is the first key sequence, except that key sequences consisting entirely of

trans-unit.source: If fixedcase is non-nil, then replace-match uses the replacement text without case conversion; otherwise, it converts the replacement text depending upon the capitalization of the text to be replaced. If the original text is all upper case, this converts the replacement text to upper case. If all words of the original text are capitalized, this capitalizes all the words of the replacement text. If all the words are one-letter and they are all upper case, they are treated as capitalized words rather than all-upper-case words.
trans-unit.target: If fixedcase is non- nil , then replace-match uses the replacement text without case conversion; otherwise, it converts the replacement text depending upon the capitalization of the text to be replaced. If the original text is all upper case, this converts the replacement text to upper case. If all words of the original text are capitalized, this capitalizes all the words of the replacement text. If all the words are one-letter and they are all upper case, they are treated as capitalized words rather than all-upper-case words.

trans-unit.source: If flow is non-nil, then Emacs uses XON/XOFF (
trans-unit.target: If flow is non- nil , then Emacs uses XON/XOFF (

trans-unit.source: If focus-frame is omitted or nil, that cancels any existing redirection for frame, which therefore once again receives its own events.
trans-unit.target: If focus-frame is omitted or nil , that cancels any existing redirection for frame , which therefore once again receives its own events.

trans-unit.source: If font is a font spec and the font spec does not specify property, the return value is nil. If font is a font object or font entity, the value for the :script property may be a list of scripts supported by the font.
trans-unit.target: If font is a font spec and the font spec does not specify property , the return value is nil . If font is a font object or font entity, the value for the :script property may be a list of scripts supported by the font.

trans-unit.source: If <var>fontname-regexp</var> matches the font name that is about to be used, this says to choose a larger similar font according to the factor <var>scale-factor</var>. You would use this feature to normalize the font size if certain fonts are bigger or smaller than their nominal heights and widths would suggest.
trans-unit.target: If <var>fontname-regexp</var> matches the font name that is about to be used, this says to choose a larger similar font according to the factor <var>scale-factor</var> . You would use this feature to normalize the font size if certain fonts are bigger or smaller than their nominal heights and widths would suggest.

trans-unit.source: If for-call-interactively is non-nil, then commandp returns t only for objects that call-interactively could call—thus, not for keyboard macros.
trans-unit.target: If for-call-interactively is non- nil , then commandp returns t only for objects that call-interactively could call—thus, not for keyboard macros.

trans-unit.source: If force is non-nil, that says to fix the line’s indentation if that doesn’t match the left margin value.
trans-unit.target: If force is non- nil , that says to fix the line’s indentation if that doesn’t match the left margin value.

trans-unit.source: If force is non-nil, this command recompiles every ‘
trans-unit.target: If force is non- nil , this command recompiles every ‘

trans-unit.source: If format-string is nil or the empty string, message clears the echo area; if the echo area has been expanded automatically, this brings it back to its normal size. If the minibuffer is active, this brings the minibuffer contents back onto the screen immediately.
trans-unit.target: If format-string is nil or the empty string, message clears the echo area; if the echo area has been expanded automatically, this brings it back to its normal size. If the minibuffer is active, this brings the minibuffer contents back onto the screen immediately.

trans-unit.source: If frame-number is out of range, backtrace-frame returns nil.
trans-unit.target: If frame-number is out of range, backtrace-frame returns nil .

trans-unit.source: If frame has a non-nilbuffer-predicate parameter, then other-buffer uses that predicate to decide which buffers to consider. It calls the predicate once for each buffer, and if the value is nil, that buffer is ignored. See Buffer Parameters.
trans-unit.target: If frame has a non- nil buffer-predicate parameter, then other-buffer uses that predicate to decide which buffers to consider. It calls the predicate once for each buffer, and if the value is nil , that buffer is ignored. See Buffer Parameters.

trans-unit.source: If frame has at least one side window, this command saves the state of frame’s root window in the frame’s window-state frame parameter and deletes all side windows on frame afterwards.
trans-unit.target: If frame has at least one side window, this command saves the state of frame ’s root window in the frame ’s window-state frame parameter and deletes all side windows on frame afterwards.

trans-unit.source: If frame has no side windows, but does have a window-state parameter, this command uses that parameter’s value to restore the side windows on frame leaving frame’s main window alone.
trans-unit.target: If frame has no side windows, but does have a window-state parameter, this command uses that parameter’s value to restore the side windows on frame leaving frame ’s main window alone.

trans-unit.source: If frame has no side windows, it returns frame’s root window. Otherwise, it returns either an internal non-side window such that all other non-side windows on frame descend from it, or the single live non-side window of frame. Note that the main window of a frame cannot be deleted via delete-window.
trans-unit.target: If frame has no side windows, it returns frame ’s root window. Otherwise, it returns either an internal non-side window such that all other non-side windows on frame descend from it, or the single live non-side window of frame . Note that the main window of a frame cannot be deleted via delete-window .

trans-unit.source: If frame is t, this function sets the default attributes for newly created frames. If frame is nil, this function sets the attributes for all existing frames, as well as for newly created frames.
trans-unit.target: If frame is t , this function sets the default attributes for newly created frames. If frame is nil , this function sets the attributes for all existing frames, as well as for newly created frames.

trans-unit.source: If frame is a frame, this returns frame’s local buffer list. If frame is nil or omitted, the fundamental buffer list is used: the buffers appear in order of most recent display or selection, regardless of which frames they were displayed on.
trans-unit.target: If frame is a frame, this returns frame ’s local buffer list. If frame is nil or omitted, the fundamental buffer list is used: the buffers appear in order of most recent display or selection, regardless of which frames they were displayed on.

trans-unit.source: If frame is omitted or nil, that means the selected frame (see Input Focus). If frame is t, this function returns the value of the specified attribute for newly-created frames (this is normally unspecified, unless you have specified some value using set-face-attribute; see below).
trans-unit.target: If frame is omitted or nil , that means the selected frame (see Input Focus). If frame is t , this function returns the value of the specified attribute for newly-created frames (this is normally unspecified , unless you have specified some value using set-face-attribute ; see below).

trans-unit.source: If <var>frame</var> is the selected frame, this makes <var>window</var> the selected window.
trans-unit.target: If <var>frame</var> is the selected frame, this makes <var>window</var> the selected window.

trans-unit.source: If <var>from-fn</var> is a function, it is called with two arguments, <var>begin</var> and <var>end</var>, which specify the part of the buffer it should convert. It should convert the text by editing it in place. Since this can change the length of the text, <var>from-fn</var> should return the modified end position.
trans-unit.target: If <var>from-fn</var> is a function, it is called with two arguments, <var>begin</var> and <var>end</var> , which specify the part of the buffer it should convert. It should convert the text by editing it in place. Since this can change the length of the text, <var>from-fn</var> should return the modified end position.

trans-unit.source: If from-string contains upper-case letters, then perform-replace binds case-fold-search to nil, and it uses the replacements without altering their case.
trans-unit.target: If from-string contains upper-case letters, then perform-replace binds case-fold-search to nil , and it uses the replacements without altering their case.

trans-unit.target: If full-directory-p is non- nil , that means the directory listing is expected to show the full contents of a directory. You should specify t when file is a directory and switches do not contain ‘

trans-unit.target: If full-name is non- nil , the function returns the files’ absolute file names. Otherwise, it returns the names relative to the specified directory.

trans-unit.source: If <var>fun</var> changes the window configuration by splitting or deleting windows, that does not alter the set of windows walked, which is determined prior to calling <var>fun</var> for the first time.
trans-unit.target: If <var>fun</var> changes the window configuration by splitting or deleting windows, that does not alter the set of windows walked, which is determined prior to calling <var>fun</var> for the first time.

trans-unit.source: If function has a non-nil property permanent-local-hook, then kill-all-local-variables (or changing major modes) won’t delete it from the hook variable’s local value.
trans-unit.target: If function has a non- nil property permanent-local-hook , then kill-all-local-variables (or changing major modes) won’t delete it from the hook variable’s local value.

trans-unit.source: If <var>function</var> is a byte-code function object, this immediately finishes loading the byte code of <var>function</var> from its byte-compiled file, if it is not fully loaded already. Otherwise, it does nothing. It always returns <var>function</var>.
trans-unit.target: If <var>function</var> is a byte-code function object, this immediately finishes loading the byte code of <var>function</var> from its byte-compiled file, if it is not fully loaded already. Otherwise, it does nothing. It always returns <var>function</var> .

trans-unit.source: If function is a symbol, this function first looks for the function-documentation property of that symbol; if that has a non-nil value, the documentation comes from that value (if the value is not a string, it is evaluated).
trans-unit.target: If function is a symbol, this function first looks for the function-documentation property of that symbol; if that has a non- nil value, the documentation comes from that value (if the value is not a string, it is evaluated).

trans-unit.source: If function is already present in hook (comparing using equal), then add-hook does not add it a second time.
trans-unit.target: If function is already present in hook (comparing using equal ), then add-hook does not add it a second time.

trans-unit.source: If function is not a symbol, or if it has no function-documentation property, then documentation extracts the documentation string from the actual function definition, reading it from a file if called for.
trans-unit.target: If function is not a symbol, or if it has no function-documentation property, then documentation extracts the documentation string from the actual function definition, reading it from a file if called for.

trans-unit.source: If function is not interactive, then the combined function will inherit the interactive spec, if any, of the original function. Else, the combined function will be interactive and will use the interactive spec of function. One exception: if the interactive spec of function is a function (i.e., a lambda expression or an fbound symbol rather than an expression or a string), then the interactive spec of the combined function will be a call to that function with as sole argument the interactive spec of the original function. To interpret the spec received as argument, use advice-eval-interactive-spec.
trans-unit.target: If function is not interactive, then the combined function will inherit the interactive spec, if any, of the original function. Else, the combined function will be interactive and will use the interactive spec of function . One exception: if the interactive spec of function is a function (i.e., a lambda expression or an fbound symbol rather than an expression or a string), then the interactive spec of the combined function will be a call to that function with as sole argument the interactive spec of the original function. To interpret the spec received as argument, use advice-eval-interactive-spec .

trans-unit.source: If function was previously registered as a fontification function using jit-lock-register, this function unregisters it.
trans-unit.target: If function was previously registered as a fontification function using jit-lock-register , this function unregisters it.

trans-unit.source: If greedy is non-nil, this function extends the match backwards as far as possible, stopping when a single additional previous character cannot be part of a match for regexp. When the match is extended, its starting position is allowed to occur before limit.
trans-unit.target: If greedy is non- nil , this function extends the match backwards as far as possible, stopping when a single additional previous character cannot be part of a match for regexp . When the match is extended, its starting position is allowed to occur before limit .

trans-unit.target: If header is non- nil , the frame title for the box is ‘

trans-unit.source: If here is non-nil, it inserts the text in the buffer before point, and returns nil. When this function is called interactively, it prints the same information in the echo area, but giving a prefix argument makes here non-nil.
trans-unit.target: If here is non- nil , it inserts the text in the buffer before point, and returns nil . When this function is called interactively, it prints the same information in the echo area, but giving a prefix argument makes here non- nil .

trans-unit.source: If hook is a non-nil symbol whose no-self-insert property is non-nil, hook can explicitly control whether to insert the self-inserting input character that triggered the expansion. If hook returns non-nil in this case, that inhibits insertion of the character. By contrast, if hook returns nil, expand-abbrev (or abbrev-insert) also returns nil, as if expansion had not really occurred.
trans-unit.target: If hook is a non- nil symbol whose no-self-insert property is non- nil , hook can explicitly control whether to insert the self-inserting input character that triggered the expansion. If hook returns non- nil in this case, that inhibits insertion of the character. By contrast, if hook returns nil , expand-abbrev (or abbrev-insert ) also returns nil , as if expansion had not really occurred.

trans-unit.source: If human is non-nil, the description is human-oriented. System abbrevs are listed and identified as such. Otherwise the description is a Lisp expression—a call to define-abbrev-table that would define name as it is currently defined, but without the system abbrevs. (The mode or package using name is supposed to add these to name separately.)
trans-unit.target: If human is non- nil , the description is human-oriented. System abbrevs are listed and identified as such. Otherwise the description is a Lisp expression—a call to define-abbrev-table that would define name as it is currently defined, but without the system abbrevs. (The mode or package using name is supposed to add these to name separately.)

trans-unit.source: If ignore-case is non-nil, characters are converted to lower-case before comparing them.
trans-unit.target: If ignore-case is non- nil , characters are converted to lower-case before comparing them.

trans-unit.source: If <var>image</var> is a single image specification, Emacs draws the tool bar button in disabled state by applying an edge-detection algorithm to the image.
trans-unit.target: If <var>image</var> is a single image specification, Emacs draws the tool bar button in disabled state by applying an edge-detection algorithm to the image.

trans-unit.source: If include-cmds is non-nil, complete key sequences in the result vector are interleaved with pseudo-events of the form (nil . COMMAND), where COMMAND is the binding of the key sequence (see Command Overview).
trans-unit.target: If include-cmds is non- nil , complete key sequences in the result vector are interleaved with pseudo-events of the form (nil . COMMAND) , where COMMAND is the binding of the key sequence (see Command Overview).

trans-unit.source: If inherit-input-method is non-nil, then the current input method (if any) is employed to make it possible to enter a non-
trans-unit.target: If inherit-input-method is non- nil , then the current input method (if any) is employed to make it possible to enter a non-

trans-unit.source: If inherit is nil, only attributes directly defined by face are considered, so the return value may be unspecified, or a relative value. If inherit is non-nil, face’s definition of attribute is merged with the faces specified by its :inherit attribute; however the return value may still be unspecified or relative. If inherit is a face or a list of faces, then the result is further merged with that face (or faces), until it becomes specified and absolute.
trans-unit.target: If inherit is nil , only attributes directly defined by face are considered, so the return value may be unspecified , or a relative value. If inherit is non- nil , face ’s definition of attribute is merged with the faces specified by its :inherit attribute; however the return value may still be unspecified or relative. If inherit is a face or a list of faces, then the result is further merged with that face (or faces), until it becomes specified and absolute.

trans-unit.source: If inherit is non-nil, the inserted characters inherit sticky text properties from the two characters before and after the insertion point. See Sticky Properties.
trans-unit.target: If inherit is non- nil , the inserted characters inherit sticky text properties from the two characters before and after the insertion point. See Sticky Properties.

trans-unit.source: If <var>initial</var> is a string, the minibuffer starts out containing the text of the string, with point at the end, when the user starts to edit the text. If the user simply types
trans-unit.target: If <var>initial</var> is a string, the minibuffer starts out containing the text of the string, with point at the end, when the user starts to edit the text. If the user simply types

trans-unit.source: If interactive is non-nil, that says function can be called interactively. This lets completion in
trans-unit.target: If interactive is non- nil , that says function can be called interactively. This lets completion in

trans-unit.source: If iterator is suspended inside an unwind-protect’s bodyform and becomes unreachable, Emacs will eventually run unwind handlers after a garbage collection pass. (Note that iter-yield is illegal inside an unwind-protect’s unwindforms.) To ensure that these handlers are run before then, use iter-close.
trans-unit.target: If iterator is suspended inside an unwind-protect ’s bodyform and becomes unreachable, Emacs will eventually run unwind handlers after a garbage collection pass. (Note that iter-yield is illegal inside an unwind-protect ’s unwindforms .) To ensure that these handlers are run before then, use iter-close .

trans-unit.source: If <var>kbdmacro</var> is a symbol, then its function definition is used in place of <var>kbdmacro</var>. If that is another symbol, this process repeats. Eventually the result should be a string or vector. If the result is not a symbol, string, or vector, an error is signaled.
trans-unit.target: If <var>kbdmacro</var> is a symbol, then its function definition is used in place of <var>kbdmacro</var> . If that is another symbol, this process repeats. Eventually the result should be a string or vector. If the result is not a symbol, string, or vector, an error is signaled.

trans-unit.source: If keep-backup-version is non-nil, then true file version numbers understood as such by the file system are discarded from the return value, but backup version numbers are kept.
trans-unit.target: If keep-backup-version is non- nil , then true file version numbers understood as such by the file system are discarded from the return value, but backup version numbers are kept.

trans-unit.source: If keep-mode-if-same is non-nil, this function does not call the mode command if the buffer is already in the proper major mode. For instance, set-visited-file-name sets this to t to avoid killing buffer local variables that the user may have set.
trans-unit.target: If keep-mode-if-same is non- nil , this function does not call the mode command if the buffer is already in the proper major mode. For instance, set-visited-file-name sets this to t to avoid killing buffer local variables that the user may have set.

trans-unit.source: If keepalive-flag is non-nil for a stream connection, enable exchange of low-level keep-alive messages.
trans-unit.target: If keepalive-flag is non- nil for a stream connection, enable exchange of low-level keep-alive messages.

trans-unit.source: If <var>key-regexp</var> is:
trans-unit.target: If <var>key-regexp</var> is:

trans-unit.source: If key contains a meta character (not a function key), that character is implicitly replaced by a two-character sequence: the value of meta-prefix-char, followed by the corresponding non-meta character. Thus, the first example below is handled by conversion into the second example.
trans-unit.target: If key contains a meta character (not a function key), that character is implicitly replaced by a two-character sequence: the value of meta-prefix-char , followed by the corresponding non-meta character. Thus, the first example below is handled by conversion into the second example.

trans-unit.source: If key is [t], this sets the default binding in keymap. When an event has no binding of its own, the Emacs command loop uses the keymap’s default binding, if there is one.
trans-unit.target: If key is [t] , this sets the default binding in keymap . When an event has no binding of its own, the Emacs command loop uses the keymap’s default binding, if there is one.

trans-unit.source: If key is t, the value is the complete status information for the connection, server, serial port, or pipe; that is, the list of keywords and values specified in make-network-process, make-serial-process, or make-pipe-process, except that some of the values represent the current status instead of what you specified.
trans-unit.target: If key is t , the value is the complete status information for the connection, server, serial port, or pipe; that is, the list of keywords and values specified in make-network-process , make-serial-process , or make-pipe-process , except that some of the values represent the current status instead of what you specified.

trans-unit.source: If <var>key</var> is a keyword, the function returns the value corresponding to that keyword.
trans-unit.target: If <var>key</var> is a keyword, the function returns the value corresponding to that keyword.

trans-unit.source: If key starts with a mouse event (perhaps following a prefix event), the maps to be consulted are determined based on the event’s position. Otherwise, they are determined based on the value of point. However, you can override either of them by specifying position. If position is non-nil, it should be either a buffer position or an event position like the value of event-start. Then the maps consulted are determined based on position.
trans-unit.target: If key starts with a mouse event (perhaps following a prefix event), the maps to be consulted are determined based on the event’s position. Otherwise, they are determined based on the value of point. However, you can override either of them by specifying position . If position is non- nil , it should be either a buffer position or an event position like the value of event-start . Then the maps consulted are determined based on position .

trans-unit.source: If <var>keymap</var> has submaps (bindings for prefix keys), they too receive new parent keymaps that reflect what <var>parent</var> specifies for those prefix keys.
trans-unit.target: If <var>keymap</var> has submaps (bindings for prefix keys), they too receive new parent keymaps that reflect what <var>parent</var> specifies for those prefix keys.

trans-unit.source: If keymap is nil, then the maps used are the current active keymaps, disregarding overriding-local-map (that is, pretending its value is nil). If keymap is a keymap, then the maps searched are keymap and the global keymap. If keymap is a list of keymaps, only those keymaps are searched.
trans-unit.target: If keymap is nil , then the maps used are the current active keymaps, disregarding overriding-local-map (that is, pretending its value is nil ). If keymap is a keymap, then the maps searched are keymap and the global keymap. If keymap is a list of keymaps, only those keymaps are searched.

trans-unit.source: If keymap is non-nil, that keymap is the local keymap to use in the minibuffer. If keymap is omitted or nil, the value of minibuffer-local-map is used as the keymap. Specifying a keymap is the most important way to customize the minibuffer for various applications such as completion.
trans-unit.target: If keymap is non- nil , that keymap is the local keymap to use in the minibuffer. If keymap is omitted or nil , the value of minibuffer-local-map is used as the keymap. Specifying a keymap is the most important way to customize the minibuffer for various applications such as completion.

trans-unit.source: If laxmatch is non-nil, it means there should be no error if there is no subexpression numbered subexp in matcher. Obviously, fontification of the subexpression numbered subexp will not occur. However, fontification of other subexpressions (and other regexps) will continue. If laxmatch is nil, and the specified subexpression is missing, then an error is signaled which terminates search-based fontification.
trans-unit.target: If laxmatch is non- nil , it means there should be no error if there is no subexpression numbered subexp in matcher . Obviously, fontification of the subexpression numbered subexp will not occur. However, fontification of other subexpressions (and other regexps) will continue. If laxmatch is nil , and the specified subexpression is missing, then an error is signaled which terminates search-based fontification.

trans-unit.source: If left is non-nil and inverse is nil, this means that the y-pixel value returned for any line specifies the distance in pixels from the left edge of the last (leftmost) glyph of that line to the right edge (body edge if body is non-nil) of window. If left and inverse are both non-nil, the y-pixel value returned for any line specifies the distance in pixels from the left edge (body edge if body is non-nil) of window to the left edge of the last (leftmost) glyph of that line.
trans-unit.target: If left is non- nil and inverse is nil , this means that the y-pixel value returned for any line specifies the distance in pixels from the left edge of the last (leftmost) glyph of that line to the right edge (body edge if body is non- nil ) of window . If left and inverse are both non- nil , the y-pixel value returned for any line specifies the distance in pixels from the left edge (body edge if body is non- nil ) of window to the left edge of the last (leftmost) glyph of that line.

trans-unit.source: If limit is t, it means to choose a new seed as if Emacs were restarting, typically from the system entropy. On systems lacking entropy pools, choose the seed from less-random volatile data such as the current time.
trans-unit.target: If limit is t , it means to choose a new seed as if Emacs were restarting, typically from the system entropy. On systems lacking entropy pools, choose the seed from less-random volatile data such as the current time.

trans-unit.source: If limit is a positive fixnum, the value is chosen to be nonnegative and less than limit. Otherwise, the value might be any fixnum, i.e., any integer from most-negative-fixnum through most-positive-fixnum (see Integer Basics).
trans-unit.target: If limit is a positive fixnum, the value is chosen to be nonnegative and less than limit . Otherwise, the value might be any fixnum, i.e., any integer from most-negative-fixnum through most-positive-fixnum (see Integer Basics).

trans-unit.source: If <var>limit</var> is a string, it means to choose a new seed based on the string’s contents.
trans-unit.target: If <var>limit</var> is a string, it means to choose a new seed based on the string’s contents.

trans-unit.source: If limit is non-nil, it is a buffer position; if the beginning of the field is before limit, then limit will be returned instead.
trans-unit.target: If limit is non- nil , it is a buffer position; if the beginning of the field is before limit , then limit will be returned instead.

trans-unit.source: If limit is non-nil, it is a buffer position; if the end of the field is after limit, then limit will be returned instead.
trans-unit.target: Si el limit no es nil , es una posición de búfer; si el final del campo es posterior al limit , entonces se devolverá el limit .

trans-unit.source: If limit is non-nil, it must be a position in the current buffer. It specifies the upper bound to the search. No match extending after that position is accepted. If limit is omitted or nil, it defaults to the end of the accessible portion of the buffer.
trans-unit.target: Si el limit no es nil , debe ser una posición en el búfer actual. Especifica el límite superior de la búsqueda. No se acepta ninguna coincidencia que se extienda después de esa posición. Si se omite el limit o es nil , el valor predeterminado es el final de la parte accesible del búfer.

trans-unit.source: If limit is non-nil, it must be a position in the current buffer; it specifies the upper bound to the search. The match found must not extend after that position.
trans-unit.target: Si el limit no es nil , debe ser una posición en el búfer actual; especifica el límite superior de la búsqueda. El partido encontrado no debe extenderse después de esa posición.

trans-unit.source: If limit is non-nil, then the scan ends at position limit. If there is no property change before that point, next-single-property-change returns limit.
trans-unit.target: Si el limit no es nil , la exploración finaliza en el limit posición . Si no hay ningún cambio de propiedad antes de ese punto, el next-single-property-change devuelve el limit .

trans-unit.source: If limit is non-nil, then the scan ends at position limit. If there is no property change before that point, this function returns limit.
trans-unit.target: Si el limit no es nil , la exploración finaliza en el limit posición . Si no hay ningún cambio de propiedad antes de ese punto, esta función devuelve el limit .

trans-unit.source: If <var>limit</var> is supplied (it must be a number or a marker), it specifies the maximum position in the buffer that point can be skipped to. Point will stop at or before <var>limit</var>.
trans-unit.target: Si se proporciona el <var>limit</var> (debe ser un número o un marcador), especifica la posición máxima en el búfer a la que se puede saltar el punto. El punto se detendrá en el <var>limit</var> o antes .

trans-unit.source: If linger-arg is non-nil, wait for successful transmission of all queued packets on the connection before it is deleted (see delete-process). If linger-arg is an integer, it specifies the maximum time in seconds to wait for queued packets to be sent before closing the connection. The default is nil, which means to discard unsent queued packets when the process is deleted.
trans-unit.target: Si linger-arg no es nil , espere a que la transmisión de todos los paquetes en cola en la conexión se realice correctamente antes de eliminarlo (consulte delete-process ). Si linger-arg es un número entero, especifica el tiempo máximo en segundos para esperar a que se envíen los paquetes en cola antes de cerrar la conexión. El valor predeterminado es nil , lo que significa descartar los paquetes en cola no enviados cuando se elimina el proceso.

trans-unit.source: If list is not nil or a cons cell, safe-length returns 0.
trans-unit.target: Si la list a no es nil o una celda de cons, safe-length devuelve 0.

trans-unit.source: If literal is non-nil, then replacement is inserted exactly as it is, the only alterations being case changes as needed. If it is nil (the default), then the character ‘
trans-unit.target: Si literal no es nil , entonces el replacement se inserta exactamente como está, las únicas alteraciones son los cambios de caso según sea necesario. Si es nil (el valor predeterminado), entonces el carácter '

trans-unit.source: If load is non-nil, this command loads the compiled file after compiling it. Interactively, load is the prefix argument.
trans-unit.target: Si load no es nil , este comando carga el archivo compilado después de compilarlo. De forma interactiva, load es el argumento del prefijo.

trans-unit.source: If local is non-nil, that says to add function to the buffer-local hook list instead of to the global hook list. This makes the hook buffer-local and adds t to the buffer-local value. The latter acts as a flag to run the hook functions in the default value as well as in the local value.
trans-unit.target: Si local no es nil , eso indica que se debe agregar una function a la lista de ganchos de búfer local en lugar de a la lista de enganches global. Esto hace que el gancho sea local al búfer y agrega t al valor local del búfer. Este último actúa como una bandera para ejecutar las funciones de enlace en el valor predeterminado, así como en el valor local.

trans-unit.source: If local is non-nil, that says to remove function from the buffer-local hook list instead of from the global hook list.
trans-unit.target: Si local no es nil , eso dice que se elimine la function de la lista de enganches del búfer local en lugar de la lista de enganches global.

trans-unit.source: If loopfunc is non-nil, it is a function that is called, without arguments, prior to each iteration of the macro. If loopfunc returns nil, then this stops execution of the macro.
trans-unit.target: Si loopfunc no es nil , es una función que se llama, sin argumentos, antes de cada iteración de la macro. Si loopfunc devuelve nil , esto detiene la ejecución de la macro.

trans-unit.source: If mask is heuristic or (heuristic bg), build a clipping mask for the image, so that the background of a frame is visible behind the image. If bg is not specified, or if bg is t, determine the background color of the image by looking at the four corners of the image, assuming the most frequently occurring color from the corners is the background color of the image. Otherwise, bg must be a list (red green blue) specifying the color to assume for the background of the image.
trans-unit.target: Si la mask es heuristic o (heuristic bg) , cree una máscara de recorte para la imagen, de modo que el fondo de un marco sea visible detrás de la imagen. Si no se especifica bg , o si bg es t , determine el color de fondo de la imagen observando las cuatro esquinas de la imagen, asumiendo que el color que aparece con más frecuencia en las esquinas es el color de fondo de la imagen. De lo contrario, bg debe ser una lista (red green blue) especifique el color a asumir para el fondo de la imagen.

trans-unit.source: If mask is nil, remove a mask from the image, if it has one. Images in some formats include a mask which can be removed by specifying :mask nil.
trans-unit.target: Si la mask es nil , elimine una máscara de la imagen, si tiene una. Las imágenes en algunos formatos incluyen una máscara que se puede eliminar especificando :mask nil .

trans-unit.source: If <var>match-list</var> refers to a buffer that doesn’t exist, you don’t get an error; that sets the match data in a meaningless but harmless way.
trans-unit.target: Si <var>match-list</var> refiere a un búfer que no existe, no obtendrá un error; que establece los datos de coincidencia de una manera inofensiva pero sin sentido.

trans-unit.source: If match-regexp is non-nil, this function returns only those file names that contain a match for that regular expression—the other file names are excluded from the list. On case-insensitive filesystems, the regular expression matching is case-insensitive.
trans-unit.target: Si match-regexp no es nil , esta función devuelve solo aquellos nombres de archivo que contienen una coincidencia para esa expresión regular; los otros nombres de archivo se excluyen de la lista. En sistemas de archivos que no distinguen entre mayúsculas y minúsculas, la coincidencia de expresiones regulares no distingue entre mayúsculas y minúsculas.

trans-unit.source: If <var>message</var> is a string, then the optional argument <var>buffer-name</var> is the name of the buffer used to display it when a pop-up buffer is used, defaulting to
trans-unit.target: Si el <var>message</var> es una cadena, entonces el argumento opcional <var>buffer-name</var> es el nombre del búfer usado para mostrarlo cuando se usa un búfer emergente, por defecto es

trans-unit.source: If message is non-nil, it is displayed in the echo area while string is displayed in the buffer. If it is nil, a default message says to type char to continue.
trans-unit.target: Si el message no es nil , se muestra en el área de eco mientras que la string se muestra en el búfer. Si es nil , un mensaje predeterminado dice que escriba char para continuar.

trans-unit.source: If <var>min-value</var> and <var>max-value</var> are numbers, you can give the argument <var>current-value</var> a numerical value specifying the initial progress; if omitted, this defaults to <var>min-value</var>.
trans-unit.target: Si <var>min-value</var> y <var>max-value</var> son números, puede darle al argumento <var>current-value</var> un valor numérico que especifique el progreso inicial; si se omite, el valor predeterminado es <var>min-value</var> .

trans-unit.source: If minibuf is t, the cyclic ordering includes all minibuffer windows. If minibuf is neither t nor nil, minibuffer windows are not included even if they are active.
trans-unit.target: Si minibuf es t , el orden cíclico incluye todas las ventanas del minibúfer. Si minibuf no es ni t ni nil , las ventanas del minibúfer no se incluyen incluso si están activas.

trans-unit.source: If mode is nil, this function adds keywords to font-lock-keywords in the current buffer. This way of calling font-lock-add-keywords is usually used in mode hook functions.
trans-unit.target: Si el mode es nil , esta función agrega keywords a font-lock-keywords en el búfer actual. Esta forma de llamar a font-lock-add-keywords se usa generalmente en funciones de gancho de modo.

trans-unit.source: If mode is a symbol which is a major mode command name, such as c-mode, the effect is that enabling Font Lock mode in mode will add keywords to font-lock-keywords. Calling with a non-nil value of mode is correct only in your
trans-unit.target: Si mode es un símbolo que es un nombre de comando de modo principal, como c-mode , el efecto es que habilitar el modo Font Lock en el mode agregará keywords a font-lock-keywords . Llamar con un valor de mode no sea nil es correcto solo en su

trans-unit.source: If multibyte is non-nil, strings given to the process filter are multibyte, otherwise they are unibyte. The default is t.
trans-unit.target: Si multibyte no es nil , las cadenas dadas al filtro de proceso son multibyte; de lo contrario, son unibyte. El valor predeterminado es t .

trans-unit.source: If must-succeed is non-nil, failure to open the connection terminates Emacs. Otherwise, it is an ordinary Lisp error.
trans-unit.target: Si must-succeed no es nil , si no se abre la conexión, Emacs termina. De lo contrario, es un error Lisp normal.

trans-unit.source: If mustbenew is non-nil, then write-region asks for confirmation if filename names an existing file. If mustbenew is the symbol excl, then write-region does not ask for confirmation, but instead it signals an error file-already-exists if the file already exists. Although write-region normally follows a symbolic link and creates the pointed-to file if the symbolic link is dangling, it does not follow symbolic links if mustbenew is excl.
trans-unit.target: Si mustbenew no es nil , write-region solicita confirmación si el filename nombra un archivo existente. Si mustbenew es el símbolo excl , entonces write-region no solicita confirmación, sino que indica un file-already-exists error -ya-existe si el archivo ya existe. Aunque write-region normalmente sigue un enlace simbólico y crea el archivo apuntado si el enlace simbólico está colgando, no sigue enlaces simbólicos si mustbenew es excl .

trans-unit.source: If n is non-nil, then it puts point n tenths of the way from the beginning of the accessible portion of the buffer. In an interactive call, n is the numeric prefix argument, if provided; otherwise n defaults to nil.
trans-unit.target: Si n no es nil , entonces coloca el punto n décimas del camino desde el principio de la porción accesible del búfer. En una llamada interactiva, n es el argumento de prefijo numérico, si se proporciona; de lo contrario, n toma el valor predeterminado de nil .

trans-unit.source: If n is zero, nthcdr returns all of list. If the length of list is n or less, nthcdr returns nil.
trans-unit.target: Si n es cero, nthcdr devuelve toda la list a . Si la longitud de list es n o menos, nthcdr rendimientos nil .

trans-unit.source: If n is zero, indicating a request for the latest kill, current-kill calls the value of interprogram-paste-function (documented below) before consulting the kill ring. If that value is a function and calling it returns a string or a list of several strings, current-kill pushes the strings onto the kill ring and returns the first string. It also sets the yanking pointer to point to the kill-ring entry of the first string returned by interprogram-paste-function, regardless of the value of do-not-move. Otherwise, current-kill does not treat a zero value for n specially: it returns the entry pointed at by the yanking pointer and does not move the yanking pointer.
trans-unit.target: Si n es cero, lo que indica una solicitud del último kill, current-kill llama al valor de interprogram-paste-function (documentado a continuación) antes de consultar el kill ring. Si ese valor es una función y llamarlo devuelve una cadena o una lista de varias cadenas, current-kill empuja las cadenas al anillo de muerte y devuelve la primera cadena. También establece que el puntero yanking apunte a la entrada kill-ring de la primera cadena devuelta por interprogram-paste-function , independientemente del valor de do-not-move . De lo contrario, current-kill no trata un valor cero para n especialmente: devuelve la entrada a la que apunta el puntero y no mueve el puntero.

trans-unit.source: If name is nil, this function modifies the fontset of the selected frame or that of frame if frame is not nil.
trans-unit.target: Si name es nil , esta función modifica el conjunto de fuentes del marco seleccionado o el del frame si el frame no es nil .

trans-unit.source: If name is t, this function modifies the default fontset, whose short name is ‘
trans-unit.target: Si el name es t , esta función modifica el conjunto de fuentes predeterminado, cuyo nombre corto es '

trans-unit.source: If name is omitted or nil, it means to delete all overlays in the specified region. If start and/or end are omitted or nil, that means the beginning and end of the buffer respectively. Therefore, (remove-overlays) removes all the overlays in the current buffer.
trans-unit.target: Si el name se omite o es nil , significa eliminar todas las superposiciones en la región especificada. Si el start y / o el end se omiten o son nil , eso significa el comienzo y el final del búfer respectivamente. Por lo tanto, (remove-overlays) elimina todas las superposiciones en el búfer actual.

trans-unit.source: If new-pos is nil, then constrain-to-field uses the value of point instead, and moves point to the resulting position in addition to returning that position.
trans-unit.target: Si new-pos es nil , entonces la constrain-to-field usa el valor del punto en su lugar y mueve el punto a la posición resultante además de devolver esa posición.

trans-unit.source: If <var>newname</var> exists, then it must be an empty directory if <var>oldname</var> is a directory and a non-directory otherwise.
trans-unit.target: Si <var>newname</var> existe, entonces debe ser un directorio vacío si <var>oldname</var> es un directorio y no es un directorio en caso contrario.

trans-unit.source: If <var>newname</var> is a symbolic link, its directory entry is replaced, not the directory entry it points to. If <var>oldname</var> is a symbolic link, this function might or might not follow the link; it does not follow the link on GNU platforms. If <var>oldname</var> is a directory, this function typically fails, although for the superuser on a few old-fashioned non-GNU platforms it can succeed and create a filesystem that is not tree-structured.
trans-unit.target: Si <var>newname</var> es un enlace simbólico, se reemplaza su entrada de directorio, no la entrada de directorio a la que apunta. Si <var>oldname</var> es un enlace simbólico, esta función puede seguir o no el enlace; no sigue el enlace en las plataformas GNU. Si <var>oldname</var> es un directorio, esta función normalmente falla, aunque para el superusuario en algunas plataformas anticuadas que no son GNU puede tener éxito y crear un sistema de archivos que no esté estructurado en árbol.

trans-unit.source: If no-error is non-nil and a suitable path can’t be found, don’t signal an error. Instead, return a list of directories as before, except that nil appears in place of the image directory.
trans-unit.target: Si no-error es no- nil y no se puede encontrar una ruta adecuada, no indique un error. En su lugar, devuelva una lista de directorios como antes, excepto que aparece nil en lugar del directorio de imágenes.

trans-unit.source: If no-remap is nil, find the bindings for other-command and treat them as though they are also bindings for command. If no-remap is non-nil, include the vector [remap other-command] in the list of possible key sequences, instead of finding those bindings.
trans-unit.target: Si no-remap es nil , busque los enlaces para other-command y trátelos como si también fueran enlaces para el command . Si no-remap es no- nil , incluya el vector [remap other-command] en la lista de posibles secuencias de teclas, en lugar de buscar esos enlaces.

trans-unit.source: If no-remap is nil, return the bindings for other-command rather than command. If no-remap is non-nil, return the bindings for command, ignoring the fact that it is remapped.
trans-unit.target: Si no-remap es nil , devuelve los enlaces para other-command en lugar de command . Si no-remap es no- nil , devuelve los enlaces para el command , ignorando el hecho de que está reasignado.

trans-unit.source: If noauto is non-nil, that says not to enable or disable Auto-Save mode. The mode remains enabled if it was enabled before.
trans-unit.target: Si noauto es no- nil , eso indica que no se debe habilitar o deshabilitar el modo de guardado automático. El modo permanece habilitado si estaba habilitado antes.

trans-unit.source: If nodigits is nil, then suppress-keymap defines digits to run digit-argument, and
trans-unit.target: Si nodigits es nil , entonces suppress-keymap define dígitos para ejecutar digit-argument , y

trans-unit.source: If nodisp is non-nil, then sit-for does not redisplay, but it still returns as soon as input is available (or when the timeout elapses).
trans-unit.target: Si nodisp es no- nil , entonces sit-for no vuelve a mostrar, pero aún regresa tan pronto como la entrada está disponible (o cuando transcurre el tiempo de espera).

trans-unit.source: If noerror is nil, then word-search-forward signals an error if the search fails. If noerror is t, then it returns nil instead of signaling an error. If noerror is neither nil nor t, it moves point to limit (or the end of the accessible portion of the buffer) and returns nil.
trans-unit.target: Si noerror es nil , entonces word-search-forward indica un error si la búsqueda falla. Si noerror es t , devuelve nil en lugar de señalar un error. Si noerror no es ni nil ni t , se mueve el punto de limit (o el final de la porción accesible de la memoria intermedia) y devuelve nil .

trans-unit.source: If noerror is non-nil, that suppresses errors from actual loading of the file. In that case, require returns nil if loading the file fails. Normally, require returns feature.
trans-unit.target: Si noerror es no- nil , eso suprime los errores de la carga real del archivo. En ese caso, require devuelve nil si falla la carga del archivo. Normalmente, require feature devoluciones .

trans-unit.source: If noescape is non-nil, that inhibits use of quoting characters in the output. (This argument is supported in Emacs versions 19 and later.)
trans-unit.target: Si noescape no es nil , eso inhibe el uso de caracteres entre comillas en la salida. (Este argumento es compatible con las versiones 19 de Emacs y posteriores).

trans-unit.source: If noexclude is present and non-nil, that disables the normal action of yank-handled-properties and yank-excluded-properties on the inserted string.
trans-unit.target: Si noexclude está presente y no nil , que desactiva la acción normal de yank-handled-properties y yank-excluded-properties de la cadena insertada.

trans-unit.source: If noforce is non-nil, and position would place point off screen at the next redisplay, then redisplay computes a new window-start position that works well with point, and thus position is not used.
trans-unit.target: Si noforce no es nil , y la position colocaría el punto fuera de la pantalla en la próxima visualización, entonces la visualización calcula una nueva posición de inicio de ventana que funciona bien con el punto y, por lo tanto, la position no se utiliza.

trans-unit.source: If noforce is non-nil, this function does not recompile files that have an up-to-date ‘
trans-unit.target: Si noforce no es nil , esta función no vuelve a compilar los archivos que tienen un '

trans-unit.source: If noindirect is non-nil, where-is-internal doesn’t look inside menu-items to find their commands. This makes it possible to search for a menu-item itself.
trans-unit.target: Si noindirect es distinto de nil , where-is-internal no busca dentro de los elementos del menú para encontrar sus comandos. Esto hace posible buscar un elemento de menú en sí.

trans-unit.source: If nomodes is non-nil, that means don’t alter the buffer’s major mode, don’t process local variables specifications in the file, and don’t run find-file-hook. This feature is used by revert-buffer in some cases.
trans-unit.target: Si nomodes no es nil , eso significa que no altere el modo principal del búfer, no procese especificaciones de variables locales en el archivo y no ejecute find-file-hook . Esta función es utilizada por revert-buffer en algunos casos.

trans-unit.source: If nonstickiness is non-nil, this means that the property property is rear-nonsticky by default. Since all properties are front-nonsticky by default, this makes property nonsticky in both directions by default.
trans-unit.target: Si la nonstickiness no es nil , esto significa que la propiedad de property es trasera antiadherente de forma predeterminada. Dado que todas las propiedades son no adhesivas al frente de forma predeterminada, esto hace que la property sea no adhesiva en ambas direcciones de manera predeterminada.

trans-unit.source: If nosort is non-nil, directory-files does not sort the list, so you get the file names in no particular order. Use this if you want the utmost possible speed and don’t care what order the files are processed in. If the order of processing is visible to the user, then the user will probably be happier if you do sort the names.
trans-unit.target: Si nosort es distinto de nil , directory-files no ordena la lista, por lo que obtiene los nombres de los archivos sin ningún orden en particular. Use esto si desea la máxima velocidad posible y no le importa en qué orden se procesan los archivos. Si el orden de procesamiento es visible para el usuario, entonces el usuario probablemente estará más feliz si clasifica los nombres.

trans-unit.source: If nosqueeze is non-nil, that means do not change interior whitespace.
trans-unit.target: Si nosqueeze no es nil , eso significa que no cambie el espacio en blanco interior.

trans-unit.source: If nosqueeze is non-nil, that means to leave whitespace other than line breaks untouched. If squeeze-after is non-nil, it specifies a position in the region, and means don’t canonicalize spaces before that position.
trans-unit.target: Si nosqueeze no es nil , eso significa dejar intactos los espacios en blanco que no sean los saltos de línea. Si squeeze-after no es nil , especifica una posición en la región y significa no canonicalizar los espacios antes de esa posición.

trans-unit.source: If nosqueeze is non-nil, that means to leave whitespace other than line breaks untouched. If to-eop is non-nil, that means to keep filling to the end of the paragraph—or the next hard newline, if use-hard-newlines is enabled (see below).
trans-unit.target: Si nosqueeze no es nil , eso significa dejar intactos los espacios en blanco que no sean los saltos de línea. Si to-eop no es nil , eso significa seguir llenando hasta el final del párrafo, o hasta la siguiente línea nueva, si use-hard-newlines está habilitado (ver más abajo).

trans-unit.source: If <var>not-current</var>, if point is in a region where we have a match, then skip past that and find the next instance instead.
trans-unit.target: Si <var>not-current</var> , si el punto está en una región donde tenemos una coincidencia, omita eso y busque la siguiente instancia.

trans-unit.source: If noundo is non-nil, then subst-char-in-region does not record the change for undo and does not mark the buffer as modified. This was useful for controlling the old selective display feature (see Selective Display).
trans-unit.target: Si noundo es distinto de nil , entonces subst-char-in-region no registra el cambio para deshacer y no marca el búfer como modificado. Esto resultó útil para controlar la antigua función de visualización selectiva (consulte Visualización selectiva ).

trans-unit.source: If object1 and object2 are numbers with differing types or values, then they cannot be the same object and eq returns nil. If they are fixnums with the same value, then they are the same object and eq returns t. If they were computed separately but happen to have the same value and the same non-fixnum numeric type, then they might or might not be the same object, and eq returns t or nil depending on whether the Lisp interpreter created one object or two.
trans-unit.target: Si object1 y object2 son números con diferentes tipos o valores, entonces no pueden ser el mismo objeto y eq devuelve nil . Si son números fijos con el mismo valor, entonces son el mismo objeto y eq devuelve t . Si se calcularon por separado pero tienen el mismo valor y el mismo tipo numérico no fijo, entonces podrían ser el mismo objeto o no, y eq devuelve t o nil dependiendo de si el intérprete Lisp creó uno o dos objetos.

trans-unit.source: If object1 and object2 are symbols with the same name, they are normally the same object—but see Creating Symbols for exceptions. For other non-numeric types (e.g., lists, vectors, strings), two arguments with the same contents or elements are not necessarily eq to each other: they are eq only if they are the same object, meaning that a change in the contents of one will be reflected by the same change in the contents of the other.
trans-unit.target: Si object1 y object2 son símbolos con el mismo nombre, normalmente son el mismo objeto, pero consulte Creación de símbolos para conocer las excepciones. Para otros tipos no numéricos (p. Ej., Listas, vectores, cadenas), dos argumentos con el mismo contenido o elementos no son necesariamente eq uivalentes entre sí: solo son eq uivalentes si son el mismo objeto, lo que significa que un cambio en el contenido de uno se verá reflejado por el mismo cambio en el contenido del otro.

trans-unit.source: If <var>object</var> is a buffer, <var>pos</var> is the position in the buffer.
trans-unit.target: Si el <var>object</var> es un búfer, <var>pos</var> es la posición en el búfer.

trans-unit.source: If object is a string (an overlay string or a string displayed with the display property), pos is the position in that string.
trans-unit.target: Si el object es una cadena (una cadena superpuesta o una cadena que se muestra con la propiedad de display ), pos es la posición en esa cadena.

trans-unit.source: If object is an overlay, that overlay has a help-echo property, and pos is the position in the overlay’s buffer.
trans-unit.target: Si el object es una superposición, esa superposición tiene una propiedad de help-echo y pos es la posición en el búfer de la superposición.

trans-unit.source: If old-pos is at the boundary of two fields, then the acceptable final positions depend on the argument escape-from-edge. If escape-from-edge is nil, then new-pos must be in the field whose field property equals what new characters inserted at old-pos would inherit. (This depends on the stickiness of the field property for the characters before and after old-pos.) If escape-from-edge is non-nil, new-pos can be anywhere in the two adjacent fields. Additionally, if two fields are separated by another field with the special value boundary, then any point within this special field is also considered to be on the boundary.
trans-unit.target: Si old-pos está en el límite de dos campos, entonces las posiciones finales aceptables dependen del argumento escape-from-edge . Si escape-from-edge es nil , entonces new-pos debe estar en el campo cuya propiedad de field es igual a lo que heredarían los nuevos caracteres insertados en old-pos . (Esto depende de la rigidez de la propiedad de field para los caracteres antes y después de old-pos .) Si escape-from-edge no es nil , new-pos puede estar en cualquier lugar de los dos campos adyacentes. Además, si dos campos están separados por otro campo con el valor especial boundary , entonces cualquier punto dentro de este campo especial también se considera que está en el límite.

trans-unit.source: If oldmap is non-nil, that changes the behavior of substitute-key-definition: the bindings in oldmap determine which keys to rebind. The rebindings still happen in keymap, not in oldmap. Thus, you can change one map under the control of the bindings in another. For example,
trans-unit.target: Si oldmap no es nil , eso cambia el comportamiento de substitute-key-definition : los enlaces en oldmap determinan qué claves volver a enlazar. Las revinculaciones todavía ocurren en el keymap de teclas , no en el oldmap . Por lo tanto, puede cambiar un mapa bajo el control de los enlaces en otro. Por ejemplo,

trans-unit.source: If omit-nulls is nil (or omitted), the result contains null strings whenever there are two consecutive matches for separators, or a match is adjacent to the beginning or end of string. If omit-nulls is t, these null strings are omitted from the result.
trans-unit.target: Si omit-nulls es nil (u omitido), el resultado contiene cadenas nulas siempre que haya dos coincidencias consecutivas para los separators , o una coincidencia es adyacente al principio o al final de la string . Si omit-nulls es t , estas cadenas nulas se omiten del resultado.

trans-unit.source: If oobinline-flag is non-nil for a stream connection, receive out-of-band data in the normal data stream. Otherwise, ignore out-of-band data.
trans-unit.target: Si oobinline-flag no es nil para una conexión de flujo, reciba datos fuera de banda en el flujo de datos normal. De lo contrario, ignore los datos fuera de banda.

trans-unit.source: If operation is insert-file-contents, the argument corresponding to the target may be a cons cell of the form (filename . buffer). In that case, filename is a file name to look up in file-coding-system-alist, and buffer is a buffer that contains the file’s contents (not yet decoded). If file-coding-system-alist specifies a function to call for this file, and that function needs to examine the file’s contents (as it usually does), it should examine the contents of buffer instead of reading the file.
trans-unit.target: Si la operation es insert-file-contents , el argumento correspondiente al objetivo puede ser una celda contras de la forma (filename . buffer) . En ese caso, filename es un nombre de archivo para buscar en file-coding-system-alist , y buffer es un búfer que contiene el contenido del archivo (aún no descodificado). Si file-coding-system-alist especifica una función para llamar a este archivo, y esa función necesita examinar el contenido del archivo (como suele hacer), debería examinar el contenido del buffer lugar de leer el archivo.

trans-unit.source: If param is present and non-nil, it replaces string (or the substring of string being processed) as the object passed to function (or insert). For example, if function is yank-rectangle, param should be a list of strings to insert as a rectangle.
trans-unit.target: Si param está presente y no es nil , reemplaza la string (o la subcadena de la string está procesando) como el objeto pasado a la function (o insert ). Por ejemplo, si la function es yank-rectangle , param debería ser una lista de cadenas para insertar como un rectángulo.

trans-unit.source: If parent has a non-nilmode-class symbol property, then define-derived-mode sets the mode-class property of variant to the same value. This ensures, for example, that if parent is a special mode, then variant is also a special mode (see Major Mode Conventions).
trans-unit.target: Si el parent tiene una propiedad de símbolo de mode-class no nil , entonces define-derived-mode establece la propiedad de mode-class de variant en el mismo valor. Esto asegura, por ejemplo, que si el parent es un modo especial, entonces la variant e también es un modo especial (ver Convenciones del modo principal ).

trans-unit.source: If pattern is written as a relative file name, it is interpreted relative to the current default directory. The file names returned are normally also relative to the current default directory. However, if full is non-nil, they are absolute.
trans-unit.target: Si el pattern se escribe como un nombre de archivo relativo, se interpreta en relación con el directorio predeterminado actual. Los nombres de archivo devueltos normalmente también son relativos al directorio predeterminado actual. Sin embargo, si full es no nil , son absolutos.

trans-unit.source: If <var>pattern</var> is written as an absolute file name, the values are absolute also.
trans-unit.target: Si el <var>pattern</var> se escribe como un nombre de archivo absoluto, los valores también son absolutos.

trans-unit.source: If period is non-nil, then the returned value includes the period that delimits the extension, and if filename has no extension, the value is "".
trans-unit.target: Si el period no es nil , el valor devuelto incluye el período que delimita la extensión, y si el filename no tiene extensión, el valor es "" .

trans-unit.source: If pixels-p is non-nil, lines specifies a number of pixels. In this case, the return value is lines.
trans-unit.target: Si pixels-p no es nil , lines especifica un número de píxeles. En este caso, el valor de retorno son lines .

trans-unit.source: If pixelwise is nil, the return value is rounded down to the nearest integer, if necessary. This means that if a column on the right of the text area is only partially visible, that column is not counted. It also means that the width of a window’s body can never exceed its total width as returned by window-total-width.
trans-unit.target: Si pixelwise es nil , el valor devuelto se redondea al número entero más cercano, si es necesario. Esto significa que si una columna a la derecha del área de texto es solo parcialmente visible, esa columna no se cuenta. También significa que el ancho del cuerpo de una ventana nunca puede exceder su ancho total devuelto por window-total-width .

trans-unit.source: If pixelwise is nil, the return value is rounded down to the nearest integer, if necessary. This means that if a line at the bottom of the text area is only partially visible, that line is not counted. It also means that the height of a window’s body can never exceed its total height as returned by window-total-height.
trans-unit.target: Si pixelwise es nil , el valor devuelto se redondea al número entero más cercano, si es necesario. Esto significa que si una línea en la parte inferior del área de texto es solo parcialmente visible, esa línea no se cuenta.
